description.plain:
Andy Shauf is a Canadian singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist from Regina, Saskatchewan. He is mostly self-taught musician, accessing instruments at a young age through the Radio Shack outlet run by his parents. Born to a evangelical Christian family, Shauf began playing Christian music with his family and began professionally as a drummer for a Christian pop punk band.

He started his solo career in 2006 with his Independent release “Love and the memories of It” followed by “Grandpa Songs” in 2007.  He released  his debut album, Darker Days in 2009. Shortly after, he released two EPs, Waiting for the Sun to Leave and Sam Jones Feeds His Demons, before releasing his second studio album The Bearer of Bad News in 2012, which jump-started his career as a solo artist. Shauf’s big-break came in 2016 when he released his third studio album, The Party, to critical acclaim. It featured Shauf’s most popular song to date, “The Magician”. The album was nominated for the Polaris Music Prize and received four nominations at the Juno Awards. Shauf has been noted for his practice of recording and arranging each instrument on his albums himself.

body.plain:
Andy Shauf is a Canadian singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist from Regina, Saskatchewan. He is mostly self-taught musician, accessing instruments at a young age through the Radio Shack outlet run by his parents. Born to a evangelical Christian family, Shauf began playing Christian music with his family and began professionally as a drummer for a Christian pop punk band.

He started his solo career in 2006 with his Independent release “Love and the memories of It” followed by “Grandpa Songs” in 2007.  He released  his debut album, Darker Days in 2009. Shortly after, he released two EPs, Waiting for the Sun to Leave and Sam Jones Feeds His Demons, before releasing his second studio album The Bearer of Bad News in 2012, which jump-started his career as a solo artist. Shauf’s big-break came in 2016 when he released his third studio album, The Party, to critical acclaim. It featured Shauf’s most popular song to date, “The Magician”. The album was nominated for the Polaris Music Prize and received four nominations at the Juno Awards. Shauf has been noted for his practice of recording and arranging each instrument on his albums himself.

songs.full_title: Alexander All Alone by Andy Shauf
songs.title: Alexander All Alone
songs.lyrics:
Alexander All Alone Lyrics[Verse 1]
Alexander all alone
Smoking a cigarette
The last pack he'd ever buy
At least that's what he said
He stood up to stretch his back
And fell down to the ground

[Verse 2]
Alexander all alone
Till the neighbor caught a glimpse
Cried out for his wife
To call the ambulance
Alexander all alone
Felt them check his pulse
He heard them pronounce him dead
[Chorus]
Hell is found inside of me
And nothing else will set me free
If hell is found inside of me
Then open me up and spill me out

[Verse 3]
Alexander wondered why
No life flashed before his eyes
Why his soul did not depart
Why he found no peace of mind
Would it take a little while?
Was it the same for everyone?
Alexander realized

[Chorus]
That hell is found inside of me
And nothing else will set me free
If hell is found inside of me
Then open me up and spill me outYou might also likeEmbed

songs.full_title: All the Same by Andy Shauf
songs.title: All the Same
songs.lyrics:
All the Same LyricsThe greenest grass you'll ever see
Lies silent on the earth
Where I could never be
And the brightest sun that's ever shined
As you walk away
It dances there behind, or so I find
But it's all the same anyway

I'll hold you in the setting sun
Would that be boring
Would it be any fun for you
Maybe I could fix your pain
But what is life if it's always sunny
If there's never any rain
If it's all the same anyway, then it's all the same anyway
You are the mittens to my coldest hands
The purest rain to the driest lands
A brand new friend on a lonely day
Most beautiful girl I'd have to say
Please be mine on this very night
Hands are shaking, knees not quite
It's all the same anyway, well maybe it was but not today

Stay with me this little while because all I know is you make me smileYou might also likeEmbed

songs.title: Angela
songs.lyrics:
Angela Lyrics[Verse 1]
Angela, you need to write home
Send your mother a letter
Tell her that you're okay
'Cos i don't need the company
She's calling me like every single day

[Verse 2]
Angela, when you come home
Could you bring me back a carton of cigarettes?
When are you back anyway?
Everyone misses seeing your face
[Verse 3]
Angela, thanks for the postcard
Sounds like France is everything you dreamed
I know that we're not serious
But i wish that it could be the two of us

[Verse 4]
Angela, Jen let it out
That you had met some guy in Paris
Well let me know, 'cos that's okay
Really you don't need to say a thing

[Outro]
Angela, please come home
And tell us all your stories from far away
Angela, please come home
And tell us all your stories from far away
I bet that you would love to know
Everything that's happened hereYou might also likeEmbed
